title: Whitehall Lane 2014 Millennium MM Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: This is a blockbuster wine, full bodied and ripe, yet able to hold its considerable power in check. Its well-integrated oak and sizable structure give it weight and breadth, as well as age-worthy intrigue. Red currant, cedar and cigar box mark the flavor profile. Enjoy best 2024–2034.

title: Wrath 2015 Boekenoogen Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Winemaker Sabrine Rodems manages to tame the richness of this vineyard while retaining its hedonistic joy. Aromas of rose, pomegranate, hibiscus, rhubarb and dark spice lead into pillowy flavors of strawberry, raspberry and clove. This wine feels light and racy yet full of body and flavor.

title: Ca' del Bosco 2013 Vintage Collection Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: Toasted aromas of brioche and hazelnut meld with whiffs of yellow stone fruit. On the structured palate, a lively elegant perlage underscores Golden Delicious apple, bread crust, white peach and nectarine drop. Bright acidity lifts the rich flavors.

title: Château Monbousquet 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This is a bold wine, full of structure and dense tannins. It has layers of black fruits, juicy acidity and a ripe, chocolate-coffee character. This producer is now producing great wines with richness and concentration.

title: Château Batailley 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)
description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This smoky wine is full of dark fruits and ripe tannins. It has spice and intense acidity as well as concentrated tannins. It will be a rich wine as it develops. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Croizet-Bages 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)
description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Layers of black currant and plum fruits give this wine a bright character. It has some ripe tannins, although they do not intrude on the fine fruitiness. Its should age well over the medium term; drink from 2023.

title: Château Lafon-Rochet 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Estèphe)
description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Packed with smoky tannins and crisp fruit, this is a firm and structured wine. With attractive acidity as well as a woody flavor, it will develop steadily over the medium term. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Calon Ségur 2017 Le Marquis de Calon Ségur Barrel Sample  (Saint-Estèphe)
description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Lovely and aromatic with a soft texture, this is an immediately accessible wine. That's not to say it is missing tannins—they simply, exquisitely integrated into the black fruit notes. The wine will age quickly and is likely to be ready from 2021.
designation: Le Marquis de Calon Ségur Barrel Sample

title: Château Le Crock 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Estèphe)
description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This is a firm wine. Dark tannins and rich black plum notes give a powerful character to this very dry wine. The acidity comes through more strongly on the finish suggesting a good potential for fruity aging. Drink from 2023.

title: Clos du Marquis 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)
description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This wine has a fine structure, firm with a dry core of tannins and a juicy black currant character. The Cabernet Sauvignon from this single parcel of vines is rich, yet pleasantly fresh. It will mature quickly and then age well.

title: La Croix Ducru-Beaucaillou 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)
description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This wine, from a dedicated parcel of Ducru-Beaucaillou, is rich and structured with solid tannins. The tannins meld with ripe black plum and berry flavors offering a rich intensity.

title: Château le Gay 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)
description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This is a dense, opulent wine—the epitome of the Pomerol appellation. It is generous and open, with great dark fruits and integrated tannins that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2024.

title: Château La Fleur Peyrabon 2015  Pauillac
description: This is the Pauillac-appellation portion of a larger vineyard, Château Peyrabon, which is in the Haut-Médoc. The wine is rich, perfumed and likely to age very well. Juicy acidity and firm texture go with the black-currant fruit in a wine that will become balanced and elegant. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Le Crock 2015  Saint-Estèphe
description: With Michel Rolland as consultant and the Cuvelier family, also owners of Léoville Poyferré in Saint-Julien, in charge, no wonder this is an impressive wine. It has put on weight since it was tasted at en primeur. Packed with tannins, dark fruits and potential, it is a wine for aging. Solid tannins march along with the black fruit, acidity and spice from wood aging. The wine will take its time and will not be ready before 2025.

title: Château Mayne Vieil 2015 Cuvée Aliénor  (Fronsac)
description: This is the luxury cuvée from vineyards in the Seze family since 1918. With its perfumed fruits and firm tannins it is serious as well as sumptuous. It has weight and a dry texture that will soften into the blackberry fruits and generous structure. This wine, with its still-firm texture, needs to age, so drink from 2022.

title: Dalrymple 2014 Pipers River Cottage Block Pinot Noir (Tasmania)
description: Those who like their Pinot on the savory and earthy side will enjoy this wine. Leading with the aroma of charred, salted meat, notes of bright red fruits and herbal bitters quickly follow along. The light-bodied palate is beautifully composed, offering a wealth of fruit and floral flavors, and a long, savory finish. Drink now–2025.

title: Dalrymple 2015 Pipers River Pinot Noir (Tasmania)
description: From a consistently great producer, the 2015 Pipers River offers a wealth of aromas: sunbaked earth, dried leaves, sea spray, cocoa nibs and just-picked forest fruit. The palate is light and elegant, with soft but structured tannins and a cinnamon spice tone. It's totally approachable now but could age another five to seven years if you can bear to wait that long. Drink 2023–2025.

title: Château Belle-Vue 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: This is already a balanced wine, rich in tannins, packed with ripe blackberry fruits and with a dense texture. It has weight and richness from the 50% Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend and the 20% of Petit Verdot that adds a great structure. Drink from 2025.

title: Château Haut-Brion 2015 Le Clarence  (Pessac-Léognan)
description: This is dense and concentrated, reflecting the character of Haut-Brion itself. It has weight, firm tannins and power alongside juicy black fruits and acidity that will give great pleasure as they develop. Drink from 2023.

title: Château la Fortune 2015  Margaux
description: The small vineyard in Soussans in the northern part of the Margaux appellation has produced this richly structured wine. Dark tannins and layers of wood aging are accompanied by black-currant fruits as well as dark-chocolate flavor. This wine needs to age, and will be best from 2023.

title: Abacela 2014 Reserve East Hill Block Malbec (Umpqua Valley)
description: This sappy, sensational effort is bursting with an ultraripe flavor of crushed blueberry. Dusty tannins and a sprinkling of coffee grounds amplify the finish, with excellent texture and length, ending on a flourish of butterfat.

title: Alheit 2015 Radio Lazarus Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)
description: Pristine aromas of white melon, green plum, apple blossom and lemon leaf open the nose of this gorgeous white, with touches of fresh fynbos and almond skin for added depth. The palate offers a pithy, lightly astringent texture that supports the soft fruit flavors. This is more about structure, balance and feel than overt fruit tones, with the overall harmony and complexity to continue to evolve well through 2030.    The palate is very well balanced with fine acidity, more a textural delight than overt flavors with sublime orange pith, walnut and saline notes on the ethereal finish.

title: Anthonij Rupert 2011 Vinified and Bottled on Lormarins Cabernet Franc (Western Cape)
description: This is a complex and delicious wine that's completely inviting now, but should continue to hold well for another 5–10 years. Earthy, herbal notes of tobacco leaf, leather, cigar box and crushed violets open the bouquet, grounded by a core of lush, ripe blackberry, currant, raspberry sauce and blueberry crumble. The mouthfeel is full and robust, yet structured by fine but present tannins and bold spicy tones that carry through to the enduring finish. Drink now–2022.

title: Arpepe 2012 Inferno Fiamme Antiche  (Valtellina Superiore)
description: Wild berry, rose petal, smoke, new leather and alpine-herb aromas make for a delicate bouquet. Focused and savory, the bright, elegant palate delivers cranberry, pomegranate, white pepper and black tea framed in taut refined tannins and bright acidity. A tangy saline note lingers on the close. While some may find this almost too austere, if you love finesse you'll be captivated. Drink through 2027.

title: Ayoub 2015 Overlook Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: This complex and engaging wine threads together equal portions of red fruits, leather, coffee, chocolate and toasted coconut. The tannins retain some palate-clinging astringency, and the aging in one-quarter new French oak puts a wreath of light smoke around the finish.

title: Bellavista 2010 Pas Operé  (Franciacorta)
description: Aromas of chamomile flower, yellow stone fruit, crushed herb and brioche take center stage. On the dry, elegantly structured palate, a refined persistent perlage underscores white peach, golden apple, citrus zest and toasted almond.

title: Berlucchi NV '61 Satèn  (Franciacorta)
description: Enticing scents of white spring blossom, orchard fruit and a whiff of pastry take center stage on this elegant sparkler. Made entirely with Chardonnay, the graceful palate doles out white peach, yellow apple, lemon and a hint of brioche alongside bright acidity and a silky perlage.

title: Cordant 2015 Radian Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Paso Robles winemaker Tyler Russell applies that region's rich style to Sta. Rita Hills fruit for massive effect, great for lovers of ripeness and density. Aromas of baked vanilla cake, black cherry, loamy soil and star anise leap from the glass. Then the palate delivers loads of blackberry compote, licorice and clove, letting it all hang out yet bolstered by bright acidity and firm lavish tannins.

title: Dolin 2013 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Pomegranate, carnation, dried cranberry, potpourri, baked earth and vanilla cookie all come to the fore on the nose of this light but expressive wine from the historic vineyard. Stewed red cherry and cranberry arise on the palate alongside thyme, peppercorn and the slightest hint of game.

title: Hayotzer 2014 Winemaker's Choice Virtuoso Cabernet Sauvignon (Galilee)
description: This deep violet-red colored wine has a nose of cassis, lavender and anise. It is surprisingly soft on first sip, with tannins that gradually increase in power while showcasing flavors of black cherry, dark plum, cranberry, fennel bulb and a touch of mint. The slightly grippy finish offers pronounced notes of cherry and orange zest.
